wiki_combat_campaign_para4: %0 is the hardest campaign type having the most risk but also the largest payoff, it also offers an opportunity to occupy an enemy city if at least %1 of your soldiers survive the battle.
wiki_combat_campaign_para5: Every soldier you commit to the battle has a chance to be wounded or killed.
wiki_combat_campaign_para6: If you send wounded soldiers into battle they have a very high chance to die.
wiki_combat_campaign_para7: Healthy soldiers will be committed to battle before wounded soldiers, but if you do not have enough healthy soldiers to fill your battalion then wounded soldiers will be sent into battle.
wiki_combat_campaign_para8: You should allow your soldiers time to heal rather then sending wounded soldiers into battle as this will almost always result in high casualties.
wiki_combat_campaign_para9: Over committing soldiers to an offensive action is also a mistake, this increases the number of soldiers that can be wounded or die in a single attack action.
wiki_combat_campaign_para10: You should never send max soldiers into combat unless you need them to win, always use the smallest battalion size that gets you a good win rate.
wiki_combat_campaign_para11: A %0 advantage is a %1 chance to win.
wiki_combat_campaign_para12: The advantage/disadvantage rating is how far above or below the %0/%0 win/loss rate you are.
wiki_combat_campaign_para13: Typically you want to aim for around %0 advantage, no advantage no matter how big will guarantee you a %1 win rate but a nice advantage will cause you to win the overwhelming amount of the time.
wiki_combat_campaign_para14: If your combat advantage is above %0 then you should consider lowering your battalion size to reduce casualties.

wiki_resets_intro_para1: 종족의 신격화를 하는 방법은 어떠한 방법으로든 리셋을 하는 것입니다. 현재는 %1 종류의 방법으로 총 %0개의 리셋 방법이 있습니다
wiki_resets_intro_para2: 각 선택지는 게임을 다시 시작하게 만들고, 환생 자원을 보상으로 받은 후 다음 게임에서 게임의 진행 속도를 높입니다.
wiki_resets_intro_para3: 당신이 첫 번째로 게임을 리셋한 이후, 새 기능인 '종교'를 얻게 될 것입니다. 당신이 두 번째부터 진화시키는 종족들은 항상 바로 이전에 플레이했던 종족을 신이라고 생각할 것입니다.
wiki_resets_mad_para1: 상호확증파괴(Mutual Assured Destruction, MAD)는 첫 환생 선택지로 마주하게 될 것입니다.
wiki_resets_mad_para2: 일반적으로, 게임을 처음 시작했을 때는 가능한 한 빨리 MAD 리셋을 해야 합니다.
wiki_resets_mad_para3: 이는 우주 시대 직전에 잠금해제 될 수 있고, %0를 받을 수 있습니다.
wiki_resets_mad_para4: MAD를 잠금해제 하기 위해서는 %0과 그 다음으로 %1을 연구하여 잠금해제할 수 있습니다. (발사 시설을 건설할 필요가 없습니다.)
wiki_resets_mad_para5: 이렇게 되면 MAD는 %0 -> %1 탭에 생기게 되고, 리셋이 가능합니다.
wiki_resets_mad_para6: %0는 당신의 도시에 있는 총 인구와 사용한 지식의 양에 의해 영향을 받습니다.
wiki_resets_mad_para7: 게임을 리셋하기 전에 인구를 최대한 증가시켜 %0을 많이 얻을 수 있도록 현재 당신이 가능한 범위 내에서 최대한 많이 만드세요.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para1: 바이오시드는 보통 게임을 하는 과정에서 두 번째로 만나게 되는 초기화 방법입니다.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para2: 바이오시드 초기화를 하기 위해서는 당신의 문명이 %0을 건조하고 발사해야 합니다.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para3: 바이오시드는 초기화를 진행하면 %0와 %1를 함께 얻을 수 있습니다. %1의 양은 그 게임의 %0획득량을 기반으로 비례하도록 벌 수 있기 때문에 당신은 %0를 얻고 %1 보상도 받을 수 있습니다.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para4: %0 획득량은 MAD 리셋과 비슷하게 계산되는데, 사용한 지식량에 중점을 두지 않는다는 차이점이 있습니다.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para5: %0을 건조하기 위해서는 먼저 %1를 건설해야 합니다. %1 건설이 완료되었다면 기어 아이콘을 눌러서 메뉴를 열어 %0 건조를 시작하세요.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para7: %0이 완료되면 당신은 이 리셋 방식을 실행할 수 있습니다.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para8: 바이오시드는 당신이 다른 지형의 행성에서 플레이 할 수 있도록 할 것입니다.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para9: 다음 게임에서의 행성 선택지 수는 당신이 만든 %0의 수에 따라 달라집니다. %1이 구축될 때마다 하나 더 많은 행성 선택지가 생기게 될 겁니다.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para10: 각 행성들은 다양한 특성을 가지고 있습니다. 좌측 메뉴에서 시스템 항목의 %0 탭으로 들어가서 더 많은 정보를 볼 수 있습니다.
wiki_resets_bioseed_para11: 당신이 선택한 새 행성은 리셋 시스템을 사용하지 않는 이상 영구적으로 존재 할 것입니다.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para1: Black Hole is the third reset option normally encountered in game progression. It is found at the end of the Interstellar phase of the game.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para2: A Black Hole reset will award %0, %1, and %2. %0 & %1 follow an improved version of the MAD/Bioseed formula while %2 is awarded based on the mass of the black hole.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para3: To Black Hole reset first you must construct the %0; then you have to beef it up until it it ready to explode.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para4: Increase the mass by building a %0 and using it to eject %1 into the black hole until it reaches %2 solar masses of %1. Only %3 and %4 count as %1.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para5: Increasing regular mass is not required to trigger the Black Hole reset but it will boost the amount of %0 earned.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para6: Once you have enough %0 in the black hole you can reset using a special research option called %1.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para8: If you instead research %0 you will flush all the %1 out of the black hole and have to build it back up again.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para9: Exploding the black hole results in the destruction of your current universe and lets you pick a new one.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para10: This is the method for switching universes allowing you to reset into one of the following %0 new universes: %1.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para11: In addition to changing universes you will be able to pick from a limited selection of four planets.
wiki_resets_blackhole_para13: Advanced players will be allowed to use their G.E.C.K. if they have any.
wiki_resets_ascension_para1: 승천 is the fourth reset option normally encountered in game progression. It is found at the end of the Intergalactic phase of the game.
wiki_resets_ascension_para2: An 승천 reset will award %0, %1, and %2. %0 & %1 following an improved version of the MAD/바이오시드 formula while %2 are awarded based on the number of challenge genes activated.
wiki_resets_ascension_para3: Ascending requires building the %0 (Constructed at Sirius on the Interstellar tab) and powering it with %1MW. This power requirement can be reduced by building %2.
wiki_resets_ascension_para4: Note that before starting your journey into Intergalactic that building the 승천 machine requires you spend %0 플라스미드 and %1 파지.
wiki_resets_ascension_para5: Completing 승천 will also allow you to build a custom race. You get one custom race slot, doing a second 승천 will allow you to alter or replace your previous custom race.
wiki_resets_ascension_para6: Earning 승천 in multiple universes and with more challenges active will grant you more design points to build a better custom race with.
wiki_resets_ascension_para7: Ascending on a planet increases all existing geologies by %0 and turns it into an Ascended planet.
wiki_resets_ascension_para8: Ascended planets have %0 base Knowledge/s to the Sundial, %1 global production, and %2 global storage that stay until you leave the planet.
wiki_resets_ascension_para9: While repeated 승천 on a planet will continue to increase the values of the geology deposits, they will not make a planet more Ascended, meaning that those bonuses will not stack from multiple 승천.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para1: Cataclysm is a special reset option that can only be encountered while playing on an %0 planet.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para2: To trigger the Cataclysm you must construct and power the %0 then wait for a random earthquake event to occur.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para3: After the earthquake event you can start the Cataclysm by using the special research %0, picking %1 instead will permanently lock out the Cataclysm for that run.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para4: Once triggered it will place you into a special scenario where you have no home planet. You will continue playing the same race and will not go through evolution again.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para5: Your starting state is predetermined, so do not attempt to game the system by building up excess buildings and materials first as these will not carry over.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para6: 바이오시드 리셋과 동등한 %0, %1 을(를) 얻을 수 있습니다.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para7: Cataclysm is a brutally slow game mode, you should not try it unless you have a lot of prestige.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para8: You can soft reset to get out of Cataclysm if you decide you aren't ready for it.
wiki_resets_cataclysm_para9: Once unlocked the Cataclysm scenario can be picked as a starting game state from the evolution challenge menu.
wiki_resets_terraform_para1: %0 is a special reset option that can only be encountered while playing the %1 challenge.
wiki_resets_terraform_para2: This takes the place of %0 and is considered the same tier reset.
wiki_resets_terraform_para3: A Terraforming reset will award %0, %1, and %2.
wiki_resets_terraform_para4: You will also be awarded the opportunity to design a custom planet.
wiki_resets_terraform_para5: Your planet is not persistent and will be lost if you complete any reset that changes planets.
wiki_resets_terraform_para6: Reaching Terraforming can be brutally hard, you should not try it unless you have a lot of prestige.
wiki_resets_terraform_para7: Achieving silver star %0 will let the last planet you designed in each universe be found randomly in the future.
wiki_resets_terraform_para8: You can add %0 unique planet to the pool per universe.
wiki_resets_terraform_para9: Truepath Orbit Decay gives you more planetary points to spend but is very hard, you should not try it.
wiki_resets_terraform_para10: Your planet will have a one time bonus called %0.
wiki_resets_terraform_para11: The rejuvenated effect is only valid for the next run while the planet is still fresh.
wiki_resets_terraform_para12: The rejuvenated effect has the following properties:
wiki_resets_terraform_para13: Boosts some labor jobs by %0 (Cement Workers, Miners, Lumberjacks).
wiki_resets_terraform_para15: Boosts soldier healing (strength depends on highest level of Orbit Decay challenge completed).
wiki_resets_terraform_para16: Boosts global production by %0-%1 (decays over time).
wiki_resets_terraform_para18: Increases extremity of various planetary effects.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para1: Causing the destruction of the universe by collapsing the false vacuum is a special reset method that only exists in the Magic universe.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para2: This reset serves the same general purpose as black hole allowing you to change universes.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para3: It replaces the Black Hole reset used in other universes, black holes are not available in a Magic Universe.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para4: In order to trigger a Vacuum Collapse you must construct %0 Mana Syphons.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para5: Mana Syphons are an A.R.P.A. project and appear on the A.R.P.A. Projects tab.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para6: Each completed Syphon causes damage to the universe and adds a stacking irreversible debuff called %0.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para7: When the %0th Syphon is completed the reset will trigger automatically.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para8: Vacuum Collapse will award %0, %1, and %2 similar to a Black Hole reset.
wiki_resets_vacuum_para9: The %0 earned however is not based on the black hole size, it is instead based on your total amount of mana generation.
wiki_resets_infusion_para1: Sacrifice your entire civilization to absorb the essence of a greater demon lord and take your place as a ruler of the hell dimension.
wiki_resets_infusion_para2: This is a special late game reset used to obtain %0.
wiki_resets_infusion_para3: It does not offer any of the other basic prestige currencies.
wiki_resets_infusion_para4: To reach this reset you must conquer the Hell Spire.
wiki_resets_infusion_para5: Once you construct the Waygate you can use it to reach a demon lord. Defeating the demon lord will award a %0.
wiki_resets_infusion_para6: Consume the %0 on the research tab to trigger the reset.
wiki_resets_infusion_para7: Your next race will gain a buff called %0, this buff will decay by 2% in value after every reset until it fully dissipates.
wiki_resets_ai_para1: Get your civilization wiped out by your own self aware creation.
wiki_resets_ai_para2: This reset is available only in %0 Scenario game mode.
wiki_resets_ai_para3: To trigger this reset you must construct the %0 and raise %1 to %2.
wiki_resets_ai_para4: Than you can execute %0 which triggers the reset.
wiki_resets_ai_para5: You increase AI Drift by constructing more: %0, %1, %2, or %3.
wiki_resets_ai_para7: Completing this reset will unlock the %0 genus.
wiki_calc_plasmid_gains_total: Total %0 Gains If Over Soft Cap
wiki_p_res_plasmids_para1: Plasmids provide a global production bonus. They have a softcap of %0 which can be raised with Phage.
wiki_p_res_plasmids_para2: With CRISPR upgrades Plasmids can also gain a storage boosting effect. This extra benefit is not limited by the Plasmid softcap.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para1: Anti-Plasmids are a special variant of Plasmids which are earned only in the Anti-Matter universe.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para2: In the Anti-Matter universe Anti-Plasmids replace regular Plasmids and are awarded instead of Plasmids from anything that would normally give Plasmids.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para3: Normal Plasmids do not work in the Anti-Matter universe, and Anti-Plasmids do not work outside the Anti-Matter universe.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para4: The %0 CRISPR upgrade can change the relationship between Plasmids/Anti-Plasmids and universes allowing their effects partly operate outside their native universe.
wiki_p_res_antiplasmids_para5: Anti-Plasmids are not disabled by the No Starting Plasmids challenge.
wiki_p_res_phage_para1: Phage extends the Plasmid soft cap by 1 per Phage.
wiki_p_res_phage_para2: With CRISPR upgrades they can also provide a storage bonus.
wiki_p_res_phage_para3: Phage can also be used to purchase permanent ranks of minor traits in the genetics tab.
wiki_p_res_phage_para4: Phage purchased ranks of minor traits are retained on reset and count twice after a reset.
wiki_p_res_dark_para1: Dark Energy is earned from the Black Hole or Vacuum Collapse resets; its effect is different in each universe type:
wiki_p_res_dark_standard: Standard universe, Dark Energy boosts storage capacity.
wiki_p_res_dark_evil: Evil universe, Dark Energy increases combat loot and gives a slight Soul Gem drop rate increase.
wiki_p_res_dark_heavy: Heavy universe, Dark Energy reduces space fuel costs.
wiki_p_res_dark_antimatter: Antimatter universe, Dark Energy increases Power generated by all power sources.
wiki_p_res_dark_micro: Micro universe, Dark Energy reduces cost creep.
wiki_p_res_dark_magic: Magic universe, Dark Energy increases mana generation.
wiki_p_res_harmony_para1: Harmony Crystals are earned from the Ascension and Terraforming resets.
wiki_p_res_harmony_para2: The crystals boost the effects of Dark Energy and provide a non-homeworld cost creep discount.
wiki_p_res_harmony_para3: The cost creep discount only works if you have Ascended in the current universe, its strength depends on the challenge level the ascension was completed on.
wiki_p_res_blood_para1: Blood Stones are a resource earned by beating spire levels deep in the hell dimension.
wiki_p_res_blood_para2: The stones can be used in the %0 tab to buy special upgrades.
wiki_p_res_blood_para3: Each spire floor beaten awards a base of %0 Blood Stone plus %0 per challenge gene active (%1).
wiki_p_res_blood_para4: The %0 CRIPSR perk doubles Blood Stone gains.
wiki_p_res_blood_para5: Blood Stones are lost on reset unless you have the %0 CRISPR perk.
wiki_p_res_artifact_para1: Artifacts are gained by completing the %0 reset.
wiki_p_res_artifact_para2: They are required to purchase various %0 upgrades.
wiki_p_res_artifact_para3: Most, but not all, upgrades require %0 Artifact on every %1 level.
wiki_p_res_ai_core_para1: AI Cores are gained by completing the %0 reset.
wiki_p_res_ai_core_para2: They passively boost your Quantum Level.
wiki_reset_intro: The main method of gaining prestige is to reset your run, there are currently %0 methods available for doing this
wiki_arpa_crispr: The CRISPR Lab is unlocked under the ARPA tab and can be used to spend Plasmids to buy permanent upgrades.
wiki_arpa_blood: The Blood Infusion tab is unlocked under the ARPA tab and can be used to spend Blood Stones to buy permanent upgrades.
wiki_arpa_projects: The A.R.P.A. Projects tab is where you can build special super projects. These projects are expensive and can be built in increments. They have no limits and can be repeated infinitely.
wiki_arpa_project_launch_facility: The launch facility is a special one time project with only one rank, it unlocks the space tab and then vanishes from the projects page.
wiki_arpa_project_monument: There are %0 different types of monuments: %1. Each monument type costs a different resource type but they all have the same end effect.
wiki_arpa_project_monument_random: The monument type chosen is picked randomly. The same monument will not be picked twice in a row.
wiki_arpa_project_monument_exceptions: The Pillar of Bones is only available to Evil races, and the Megalith is only available in the Magic universe.
wiki_arpa_project_railway_homeless: Railways have a hidden effect of reducing homeless population faster. Breakpoints occur at: %0, %1, %2, %3, %4, %5, %6, %7, & %8 Railways. Everytime a breakpoint is reached the odds of reducing homeless each day increases.
wiki_arpa_project_roid_eject: Black hole mass gained from asteroids does not contribute to required masses for any achievement goals nor Dark Energy gained on Black Hole reset.
wiki_hell_threat_para1: Unchecked threat will keep growing until it reaches %0.
wiki_hell_threat_para2: The main goal in hell is to reduce this threat level to around %0 and keep it there.
wiki_hell_threat_para3: The primary way of doing this is with patrols, larger patrols will suffer less casualties but more numerous smaller patrols will more effectively combat the threat.
wiki_hell_siege_para1: Periodically the demons will launch an assault on your fortress, this is where fortress defense comes into play.
wiki_hell_siege_para2: The strength of the assault is directly proportional to the overall threat level, so keeping the threat low will weaken the siege.
wiki_hell_siege_para3: Unchecked threat is undefendable, if you take a siege with %0 threat it's almost guaranteed you'll suffer a fortress overrun.
wiki_hell_siege_para4: Defenses repel the demon assault, the higher your defense rating is the less wall damage you will take.
wiki_hell_siege_para5: With enough defense and proper threat reduction management your fortress will be totally secure.
wiki_hell_strategy_para1: It's generally a good idea to start with a small number of large patrols and then transition to a larger number of smaller patrols as you get the threat down.
wiki_hell_strategy_para2: Make sure you can replace your soldiers quick enough that you don't lose patrols due to running out of soldiers, this can lead to a death spiral if you are not able to replace lost soldiers fast enough.
wiki_hell_strategy_para3: When you are able to handle it you should run as many patrols as you safely can, but do not over extend your forces.
wiki_hell_soul_gem_para1: %0 are a rare resource found in the %1 primarily by patrols.
wiki_hell_soul_gem_para2: Each patrol has a chance to find a Soul Gem when it has an enemy encounter, naturally this means the more patrols you run the more Soul Gems you will find.
wiki_hell_soul_gem_para3: You can construct the %0 to increase the odds of a patrol finding a Soul Gem, however this also raises the general threat level.
wiki_hell_soul_gem_para4: Build Attractors cautiously or you might summon more demons then you can handle.
wiki_hell_sim: This %0 written by %1 can be very a useful tool to calculate your Soul Gem drop rate as well as testing your defenses.
wiki_hell_infernite_para2: Surveyors need to be protected or they will be killed, high threat levels will cause massive casualties while low threat levels will let them do their jobs mostly unimpeded.
wiki_hell_infernite_para3: When a Surveyor dies it takes time to repair their vehicle, a small progress bar can be seen on the Carport showing the repair in progress.
wiki_hell_infernite_para4: The game will attempt to automatically reassign a Surveyor when a new carport becomes available.
wiki_hell_pit_para1: The Pit is discovered when you accumulate a total of %0 demon kills and have a %1.
wiki_hell_pit_para2: It grants access to the %0 which can be used as a kind of Soul Gem printer.
wiki_hell_pit_para3: Once the Soul Forge is repaired all demon kills slowly fill it with souls, when it reaches capacity you gain a Soul Gem.
wiki_hell_corrupted_para1: After you research %0 there is a chance for the %1 to produce a %2.
wiki_hell_corrupted_para2: This special one time resource can be researched to unlock the %0 area of hell.
wiki_hell_corrupted_para3: This is a deep expansion game area that is considered post %0 content.
wiki_hell_pillar_para1: The Ancient Pillars (AKA Circle of Pillars) found in the %0 can be activated once for every unique species.
wiki_hell_pillar_para2: This provides a stacking permanent bonus which gives you +%0 production bonus for each pillared species called %1.
wiki_hell_pillar_para3: An additional +%0 bonus is gained if you have ever pillared your current species.
wiki_hell_pillar_para4: %0 also provides a storage bonus of %1 for each pillared species and %2 if the current species is pillared.
wiki_hell_pillar_para5: Each activated pillar additionally discounts the number of %0 segments you need to build to open the ancient gate by %1.
wiki_hell_pillar_para6: Your current %0 bonus is: %1 Production, %2 Storage.
wiki_hell_spire_para1: The Spire is an infinite arena, you construct battle mechs to assault the spire and climb floors as you beat the floor boss on each level.
wiki_hell_spire_para2: There is no maximum floor, you can climb as high as you dare.
wiki_hell_spire_para3: Each floor gets progressively harder and you will randomly encounter one of forty boss types along with varying terrain and enviromental hazards.
wiki_hell_spire_para4: Beating a floor awards %0 which is a resource that can be used to buy permanent upgrades.
wiki_hell_spire_para5: Proceeding deep enough into the spire also allows you to access the %0 reset.
wiki_hell_mech_para1: Mechs are required to defeat the spire bosses.
wiki_hell_mech_para2: There are %0 types of mechs: %1, %2, %3, %4, and %5.
wiki_hell_scout_para1: The %0 mech has minimal firepower but provides a scouting bonus to all non-scout class mechs.
wiki_hell_scout_para2: It has %0 weapon mount and no equipment slots, or %1 equipment slot with the %2 upgrade.
wiki_hell_scout_para3: The Scout mech outputs a base %0 damage points per weapon.
wiki_hell_scout_para4: The Scout mech uses %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gem to construct.
wiki_hell_scout_para5: Scout class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.
wiki_hell_scout_para6: The scouting bonus provided by scout mechs helps reduce terrain penalties on all non-scout mechs.
wiki_hell_scout_para7: Each scout mech counters %0 of the terrain penalty.
wiki_hell_scout_para8: The scouting bonus is halved if the %0 or %1 hazards are in play.
wiki_hell_scout_para9: Scouting has no effect if the terrain multiplier is above %0 for a mech and can not be raised above %0 from scouting.
wiki_hell_scout_para10: Scout mechs are %0 less effective in the concrete terrain enviroment.
wiki_hell_standard_para2: It has %0 weapon mount and %1 equipment slot, or %2 equipment slots with the %3 upgrade.
wiki_hell_standard_para3: The Standard mech outputs a base %0 damage points per weapon.
wiki_hell_standard_para4: The Standard mech uses %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gems to construct.
wiki_hell_standard_para5: Standard class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.
wiki_hell_standard_para6: Standard mechs are %0 less effective in the concrete terrain enviroment.
wiki_hell_heavy_para1: The %0 mech is a large mech with superior firepower.
wiki_hell_heavy_para2: It has %0 weapon mounts and %1 equipment slots, or %2 equipment slots with the %3 upgrade.
wiki_hell_heavy_para3: The Heavy mech outputs a base %0 damage points per weapon.
wiki_hell_heavy_para4: The Heavy mech uses %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gems to construct.
wiki_hell_heavy_para5: Heavy class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.
wiki_hell_heavy_para6: Heavy mechs are more susceptible to terrain disadvantages.
wiki_hell_titan_para1: The %0 mech is a huge mech with massive firepower.
wiki_hell_titan_para2: It has %0 weapon mounts and %1 equipment slots, or %2 equipment slots with the %3 upgrade.
wiki_hell_titan_para3: The Titan mech outputs a base %0 damage points per weapon.
wiki_hell_titan_para4: The Titan mech uses %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gems to construct.
wiki_hell_titan_para5: Titan class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.
wiki_hell_titan_para6: Titan mechs are more susceptible to terrain disadvantages.
wiki_hell_titan_para7: Titan mechs are %0 more effective in the concrete terrain enviroment.
wiki_hell_collector_para1: %0 mechs do no damage but instead salvage supply resources from the spire.
wiki_hell_collector_para2: It has %0 equipment slots, or %1 equipment slots with the %2 upgrade.
wiki_hell_collector_para3: Collector mechs use %0 mech bay space. It costs %1 supply and %2 soul gem to construct.
wiki_hell_collector_para4: Collector class mechs can use the special %0 equipment item.

wiki_planet_planet_para1: 각 행성에는 지형이 존재합니다. 최초로 시작했을 때, 당신은 기본적으로 항상 초원 지형의 행성에서 플레이 하게 될 것입니다.

wiki_events_special_intro_para1: Special events are more "event-like" than any of the other event types, typically being associated with special days or real-world holidays and lasting for limited periods of time.
wiki_events_special_intro_para2: They have a range of effects on the game, with some simply renaming some things for a day and others having associated event mechanics that can impact gameplay.
wiki_events_special_intro_para3: By toggling the %0 switch in settings, special events can be disabled if a person does not wish to experience them.
wiki_events_crystal_para1: A citizen is murdered at the lake.
wiki_events_crystal_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_valentine_para3: Seraphs are reskinned as Cherubs for the day.
wiki_events_valentine_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_unlucky_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_fool_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_hopper_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_egghunt_para2: Awards the %0 feat for finding at least %1 of %2 hidden eggs.
wiki_events_egghunt_para3: Eggs award Plasmids or Phage when found.
wiki_events_egghunt_para4: Wolven are reskinned as Bunnies for the duration of the event.
wiki_events_egghunt_para5: New runs started as Bunny during the event have extra traits: %0, %1, %2, and %3 not normally found on Wolven.
wiki_events_egghunt_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_launch_day_para1: Idled during the anniversary of the game launch.
wiki_events_launch_day_para3: Space Fuel costs are %0 lower for the day.
wiki_events_launch_day_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_solstice_para3: Thermite is created by Craftsmen and is automatically burned in the Bonfire.
wiki_events_solstice_para4: A morale bonus is gained from burning Thermite.
wiki_events_solstice_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_firework_para1: The firework feastival is a celebration of your people.
wiki_events_firework_para2: Awards the %0 feat for using the Firework Factory.
wiki_events_firework_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_halloween_condition_para2: Does not occur if special events are disabled in settings.
wiki_events_trickortreat_para1: Find hidden candies or ghosts for rewards.
wiki_events_trickortreat_para2: Awards the %0 feat for finding at least %1 hidden tricks or treats.
wiki_events_trickortreat_para3: Candy award Plasmids & Ghosts award Phage when found.

wiki_events_festive_para1: Festive versions of some species are available during the season.
wiki_events_festive_elven_para2: Holiday Elves gain extra traits: Slaver (Rank 2), Resourceful (Rank 0.5), & Small (Rank 0.25).
wiki_events_festive_centaur_para2: Reindeer gain extra traits: Beast of Burden (Rank 1), Curious (Rank 0.5), & Blissful (Rank 0.25).
wiki_events_festive_capybara_para2: Donkey gain extra traits: Beast of Burden (Rank 1), Pack Rat (Rank 0.5), & Musical (Rank 0.25).
wiki_events_festive_wendigo_para2: Krampus gain extra traits: Immoral (Rank 3), Cannibalize (Rank 0.5), & Claws (Rank 0.25).
wiki_events_festive_yeti_para2: Snowmen gain extra traits: Scavenger (Rank 3), Regenerative (Rank 0.5), & Musical (Rank 0.25).
wiki_events_festive_entish_para2: Spruce Ents gain extra traits: Photosynth (Rank 3), Optimistic (Rank 0.5), & Armored (Rank 0.25).
wiki_events_festive_condition_para2: Must start a new run during this period to gain the extra traits.
wiki_events_xmas_para3: The gift contains prestige resources depending on your personal progress.
wiki_events_xmas_para5: The 2020 gift contained: 100 + Resets + Mad Resets Plasmids, Bioseeds + Cataclysms Phage, Lifetime soldier deaths Coal, 0-4 Dark Energy, 0-5 Harmony Crystals, 0-25 Blood Stones, and 0-5 Artifacts.
wiki_events_xmas_para6: The 2021 gift contained: 100 + Resets + Mad Resets Plasmids, Bioseeds + Cataclysms Phage, Lifetime soldier deaths Coal, 0-4 Dark Energy, 0-5 Harmony Crystals, 0-25 Blood Stones, 0-5 Artifacts, and 0-5 AI Cores.
